results.title: [Automatic profiling machine]
results.brief_description: A documentary on the Profiling Machine, including all technical aspects as well as how the machine works with different tools. (Basically the machine is used for cutting down wood to different sizes.)

results.title: [Australian olympic team visits Bayer works at Leverkusen on June 22nd 1936]
results.brief_description: Documentary from 1936 about the visit of the Australian Olympic team to the Bayer Works, manufacturers of Bayer Aspirins and APC powders, at Leverkusen, near Cologne, Germany before travelling to Berlin for the Olympic Games. The Australian Olympic team are shown arriving in Cologne, Germany, and being met by representatives of the Bayer works. They move on to a casino where they have breakfast. The team’s chaperone, Mrs. Ferguson talks to long distance runner, Daryl Backhouse. At the Bayer Works factory team members Alf Watson and Pat Norton look at a machine which fills and caps vials. The team moves on and looks at a machine which makes Bayer aspirins. At a dock on the Rhine river, where raw materials for the factory are unloaded, team members L. Cook, Duncan Gray and Bill Dixson are shown standing around and chatting. After a visit to the factory the team are shown sight seeing around Cologne. Shots of a booklet signing are followed by shots of Berlin. As the Australian team disembark from their train on their arrival at a railway station in Berlin, the German Navy are shown playing ‘God save the King’ on the station’s platform. Words of the sound film are spoken by Mr. Alderson, manager of the Australian Olympic team.

results.title: [Arthur Rubinstein]
results.brief_description: Biographical documentary about world-renowned classical pianist, Arthur Rubinstein. Born in Poland in 1887, Rubinstein first visited America in 1906, playing in Philadelphia and New York. However he finally settled in Paris until 1914 when he offered his services to the British authorities as an interpreter during the period of the war. At the end of the war he returned to America performing at numerous concerts between 1919 and 1927, but it would take until 1937 before Rubinstein finally gained full recognition. Eventually settling in Hollywood he became one of the most prolific recording and concert artists, collaborating frequently with Jascha Heifetz and Gregor Piatigorsky as part of the “Million Dollar Trio”. He died in Geneva in 1982 leaving a legacy of a multitude of television and motion picture musical scores composed over a thirty-year period. This film features interviews and performances by Rubinstein, David Oistrakj, and the Million Dollar Trio. NB: Quality of picture and sound is inconsistent.

results.title: [Around Australia with Movietone; Gt. Barrier Reef; Sporting Highlights; Skiing; 1949 Melbourne Cup]
results.brief_description:
This film is a Movietone Newsreel, a theatrical news broadcast that covered significant social, cultural and political events in Australia. This newsreel consists of five sections, covering news and events around Australia in 1949.

The first section, titled ‘Around Australia with Movietone’, photographed by J. W. Trerise shows pearl divers in Darwin, Northern Territory. The film takes place on a Japanese lugger, featuring Japanese divers and Peter Nakashiba, an interpreter and advisor to the Japanese in Darwin. It shows the protective diving suits and apparatus worn by pearl divers.

The second section is titled ‘Gt Barrier Reef’ and shows people fishing from trawlers on the Great Barrier Reef. The narrator describes the fishing as a popular sport and names the type of fish, including Spanish mackerel.

In the third section, ‘Sporting Highlights’, we see a horse rodeo in Warwick, Queensland, with commentary by Jack Davey, a popular radio entertainer who narrated Movietone News reels from the 1930s to 1950s.

The fourth section is titled ‘Skiing’, and takes place at Mount Kosciuszko, showing the ski fields and resort as a popular tourist destination. It includes footage of George Day, the manager of the Chalet at Charlotte Pass and a renowned Australian skier.

The final section, titled ‘1949 Melbourne Cup’, shows the popular horse racing event at Flemington Race Course, Melbourne, which in 1949 was won by Foxzami.
results.title_for_label: [Around Australia with Movietone; Gt. Barrier Reef; Sporting Highlights; Skiing; 1949 Melbourne Cup]
